alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 3:24PM EST until December 21 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island...Connecticut... Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. Charles River At Dover affecting Middlesex and Norfolk Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Cranston...Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Westerly...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawcatuck River at Westerly. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Floodwaters approach lowest lying homes along Hiscox Road in Westerly. Along Route 3, flooding occurs at some homes in French Village in Hopkinton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Tuesday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 6.3 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 03/04/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
